statement:
Let $X$ be a measure space, and let $\Phi,f_1,f_2,\dots$ be measurable
functions such that $\int_X \Phi <\infty$ and $|f_n|\leq \Phi$ for each
$n$. If $f_n\rightarrow f$ almost everywhere, then $f$ is integrable and
$$\lim_{n\rightarrow\infty} \int_X f_n =  \int_X f.$$

This theorem is a corollary of the Fatou-Lebesgue theorem.
